intro: Sloanea ramiflora, commonly known as the ramiflorous sloanea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its woody structure and compound leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Sloanea ramiflora thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in tropical biodiversity.
